Entries.default: "I don't suppose you've found any stray souls?"
"I'm not finding anything."
"Did you find something? You have that 'look' again."
"They were merchants. Killed by Huana who said something about foreigners corrupting their lands."
[Lie] "Jumbled memories. Nothing useful."
"Well, that's a start."
"I've found some unusual stains. I don't think they're blood, but they are rather... odorous." He wrinkles his nose at a streak of something the color of a fresh bruise.
"That's koīki pulp."
"Any guesses?"
"Ew."
"So it is. But what would that be doing here?"
"The stain of koīki fruit, I say! The gods made it to soil robes and upset stomachs."
"Aye. Either that be kraken seed, which I only be half sure it ain't, or it be the pulped remnants of a koīki fruit."
"What? You ain't ever eaten a corpsefruit before? I swear, it tastes better than it smells."
"None of them are particularly informative. Or pleasant to consider." He presses his lips together in distaste.

"Aye, plenty! Mayhap-"

Aloth clears his throat to silence Iselmyr.
"That's unfortunate."
"We'll just have to keep looking. Whoever killed them couldn't have gone far."

"Still, I don't think this is mere coincidence."

He frowns, looking at the key-like symbol painted onto the sail.
"My thoughts exactly."
"Wahaki hunters smear themselves with it. We're near their island, Ori o Koīki."
"I don't know."
"I thought everyone knew: the Wahaki coat themselves with corpsefruit. Makes for better hunting."

"The Wahaki tribe smear themselves with the juice of the koīki before battle.

"And... other occasions." 

Tekēhu clears his throat to hide a broad grin.
"Them half-mad Wahaki on Ori o Koīki smear it all over theirselves. The island ain't far from here. We gave it a wide berth back on the Sorcerer, though."
"Ac. One of the fierce tribes of the Huana cover themselves in this vile fruit. I have heard it grows thick at a place called Ori o Koīki."

"Wahaki fighters smear themselves with that stuff. Shrieking mad, all of them. 

"If we sail to Ori o Koīki, best be prepared."
"I've heard they're aggressively isolationist. As for what that has to do with the Leaden Key..." He frowns, looking at the key-like symbol painted onto the sail.
"At least we know where to look next."
"Then I suppose we shall have to keep our eyes open."
"What is it, [Player Name]?"
"Did you notice their face paint?"
"That mural - that's the same headdress Thaos wore."
"I've never known anyone to live in Engwithan ruins."
"It certainly seems the Wahaki have been here a long time."
"Perhaps their chieftain will have answers for us."
"These merchants were killed by Wahaki warriors. We're near their island, Ori o Koīki."
"I only wish we could find another hapless initiate with a spare hood..." He looks at you and smiles wryly.

"Though if this becomes anything like our encounter in the Defiance Bay catacombs...

"Well, I hope we get our answers before the bloodbath." He looks at you and smiles wryly.
"Of course. The same group we met on Motare o Kōzi, as I recall."
